title: Post With Code

title: Open Mortality
text:
The Open Mortality project is a data science initiative I started since April 2022 as the Lead Data Scientist at the Centre for Global Health Research, Unity Health Toronto, and still currently lead now.
The project’s mission is to empower science for improving global health with the world’s information on mortality, captured and distributed through a web platform that has made data on over 600,000 deaths available to Unity Health, University of Toronto, and their collaborators.
For more details on Open Mortality, please visit:
openmortality.org

title: nbc4VA R Package
text:
The nbc4va R package was written during my time as a Research Assistant from August 2015 to September 2020 at the Centre for Global Health Research, Unity Health Toronto. The package contains an implementation of the Naive Bayes Classifier (NBC) algorithm used for assigning the cause of death from Verbal Autopsy (VA) with methods from Miasnikof et al (2015).
nbc4va complements the openVA suite of tools, as part of the Bloomberg Philanthropies Data for Health Initiative, and was developed for a published co-authored paper by Jha et al (2019) in BMC Medicine, where we examined six statistical algorithms for assigning the cause for 9374 deaths in India.
The package is maintained and available at:
cran.r-project.org/package=nbc4va
